key_insight: Resampling Forcing introduces a teacher-free self-resampling training scheme that lets autoregressive video diffusion models be trained end-to-end from scratch, eliminating exposure bias without relying on bidirectional teachers or online discriminators.
problem_solved: Addresses exposure bias from the trainâ€“test mismatch in autoregressive video diffusion models, and removes the need for post-training teacher models or discriminators that complicate large-scale training.
method: Self-resampling: during training the model samples and feeds back its own predicted frames to mimic test-time autoregressive rollout (teacher-free).
Integrate resampled rollouts into the training objective so gradients flow through realistic generation trajectories, enabling end-to-end optimization from scratch.
Replace external teacher/discriminator workflows with a scalable internal resampling mechanism compatible with large autoregressive video diffusion pipelines.
impact: Simplifies and stabilizes training of autoregressive video diffusion models, improving generation robustness while reducing engineering and compute overhead from teacher/discriminator-based solutions.
